This is the Factory that instantiates the IBProtocols instance.

Parameters

clientId (int) – The clientId for TWS

cancelMktData(reqId: int, tickerId: int)[source]¶

After calling this function, market data for the specified id will stop flowing.

reqId: TickerId - The ID that was specified in the call to

reqMktData().

Internal reconnection method in case of connection lose

contractDetails(reqId: int, contractDetails: ibapi.contract.ContractDetails) → dict[source]¶

Receives the full contract’s definitions. This method will return all contracts matching the requested via EEClientSocket::reqContractDetails. For example, one can obtain the whole option chain with it.

contractDetailsEnd(reqId: int) → None[source]¶

This function is called once all contract details for a given request are received. This helps to define the end of an option chain.

error(reqId: int, errorCode: int = - 1, errorString: str = 'GenericError') → None[source]¶

This event is called when there is an error with the communication or when TWS wants to send a message to the client.

Increments the reqId for TWS. This is automatically called by @request decorator

Places an order. Immediately after the order is submitted correctly, the TWS will start sending events concerning the order’s activity via openOrder and orderStatus methods

protocol¶

alias of solid.ib_protocol.IBProtocol

reqContractDetails(reqId: int, contract: ibapi.contract.Contract, **kwargs) → twisted.internet.defer.Deferred[source]¶

Call this function to download all details for a particular underlying. The contract details will be received via the contractDetails() function on the EWrapper.

reqId:int - The ID of the data request. Ensures that responses are

make_fieldatched to requests if several requests are in process.

contract:Contract - The summary description of the contract being looked

up.

reqHistoricalData(reqId: int, contract: ibapi.contract.Contract, endDateTime: str, durationStr: str, barSizeSetting: str, whatToShow: str, useRTH: int, formatDate: int, keepUpToDate: bool, chartOptions: list, **kwargs) → twisted.internet.defer.Deferred[source]¶

Requests historical data for contract.

static make_field(value: str) → str[source]¶

IB detects different fields by splitting a string using a null separator () This just adds the NULL string terminator to a common string

sendMsg(msg)[source]¶
static split_fields(buffer: bytes, separator: Optional[bytes] = b'\x00') → tuple[source]¶

Payload is made of fields terminated/separated by NULL chars. We split the bytes using the null b”" separator and return a tuple containing fields.

stringReceived(text)[source]¶

Override this for notification when each complete string is received.

@param string: The complete string which was received with all

framing (length prefix, etc) removed.

XMLRPC Server¶

class solid.xmlrpc_server.XMLRPCServer(factory)[source]¶

Bases: twisted.web.xmlrpc.XMLRPC

xmlrpc_cancelMktData(tickerId: int = - 1)[source]¶

Cancels market data subscriptions.

Parameters

tickerId (int) – The ticker ID which was specified in original market data request. Cancelling a subscription allows the user to make a subscription to a different contract and remain within the level 1 market data lines allowance.

xmlrpc_reqContractDetails(symbol: str = '', secType: str = 'STK', currency: str = 'USD', exchange: str = 'SMART', lastTradeDateOrContractMonth: str = '', strike: str = '', right: str = '')[source]¶
This returns information about a contract’s conID, symbol, local symbol, currency, etc.

reqContractDetails takes as an argument a Contract object which may uniquely match one contract, and unlike other API functions it can also take a Contract object which matches multiple contracts in IB’s database. When there are multiple matches, a list is returned

Parameters

  • symbol (str) – IB symbol (eg. SPY, AAPL, DAX)

  • secType (str) – The type of security (eg. IND, STK, OPT)

  • currency (str) – The currency of the security (eg. EUR, USD)

  • exchange (str) – The exchange (eg SMART, CBOE)

  • lastTradeDateOrContractMonth (str) – This is a date for OPTIONS (eg. 20210104) or a month for FUTURES (eg. 202103)

  • strike (str) – Strike price for options

  • right (str) – Right for options (eg. C or CALL, P or PUT)

xmlrpc_reqHistoricalData(symbol: str = '', secType: str = '', currency: str = '', exchange: str = '', durationStr: str = '1 M', barSizeSetting: str = '1 hour', whatToShow: str = 'MIDPOINT', useRTH: int = 1, formatDate: int = 1, keepUpToDate: bool = False, chartOptions=None) → List[ibapi.common.BarData][source]¶
